boardgame.name: Manhattan
Manhattan 曼哈頓
boardgame.description: In Manhattan, players construct a skyline of skyscrapers over several districts, or city blocks, of Manhattan Island. Ultimately, each player seeks to have built the tallest buildings in the most city blocks of the Island._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each turn, players will play a card that illustrates which part of a city block they may place a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;floor_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; on a building. The placement card is unique for each player in that the section they may place in is relative to their seating at the table. The player who has placed the top most floor controls that building. Each round, scores are tallied based on control of each of the neighborhoods._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the end of the game, the player who has scored the most points through area control and tallest buildings wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Note: In the Finnish edition, the districts are named after six great cities of the world: Hong Kong, Sao Paulo, Cairo, Sydney, Frankfurt and Manhattan._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;(Espa_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ntilde;ol)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;En Manhattan los jugadores construyen un 'skyline' de rascacielos en distintos distritos o zonas de la isla de Manhattan. El fin _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uacute;ltimo de cada jugador ser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute; haber construido el edificio m_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;s alto en la mayor_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;iacute;a de zonas de la isla._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Cada turno, se juega una carta que ilustra en qu_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute; parte de un bloque de la ciudad pueden poner un _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;piso_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; sobre un edificio. La carta de colaci_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;oacute;n es _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uacute;nica, en tanto cada jugador coloca en cada secci_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;oacute;n del tablero, en relaci_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;oacute;n a su posici_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;oacute;n alrededor de la mesa. El jugador que ponga el piso m_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;s alto controla el edificio. Cada turno, se realiza un recuento basado en qui_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;n domina cada uno de los barrios._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Al final de la partida gana el jugador que ha conseguido m_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;s puntos mediante el control de las _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;reas y los edificios m_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;aacute;s altos._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Rio Grande Games (RIO 338) Building boom in Manhattan! But not only there! Sky-scrapers are springing up all around the world. Players also have the opportunity to build sky-scrapers in Sydney, Frankfurt, Hongkong, Sao Paulo, and Cairo. The question each turn is whether to increase the height of one of your own buildings, or to build onto someone else’s building, making it yours! At the end of every six turns, players score for having the tallest building, the most buildings per city, and for each building they own. After four rounds, the player with the most points is the winner!
